notes: The strength talent effectively grants Faceless Void 180 health and 0.9 health regeneration.
The agility talent effectively grants Faceless Void 1.17 armor, 7 attack speed, and 7 attack damage.
The health talent increases maximum health capacity, and keeps the current health percentage.
Time Walk moves Faceless Void with a speed of 3000.
Faceless Void is invulnerable during Time Walk.
Does not disjoint projectiles upon cast.
Does not travel the full distance, when targeting closer than the max distance.
Upon cast, any damage Faceless Void took in the last 2 seconds gets healed back up. This includes damage dealt by allies. It is fully affected by heal manipulation.
It is fully affected by heal manipulation.
Backtracks the 3 damage types but not heals and HP Removal. This means it cannot backtrack abilities like Sunder, False Promise, Soul Ring and Armlet of Mordiggian.
This means it cannot backtrack abilities like Sunder, False Promise, Soul Ring and Armlet of Mordiggian.
Status buffs and debuffs, cooldowns and mana are completely unaffected.

With Aghanim's Scepter, Time Walk triggers Time Lock based on its current level on every enemy within 350 radius at the destination point. Does not perform instant attacks to trigger the Time Lock. Instead, the force proc modifier is placed on enemies, which makes Time Lock trigger on them. Dispelling this debuff does not remove the Time Lock stun, but it prevents the Time Lock instant attack from occuring.
Does not perform instant attacks to trigger the Time Lock. Instead, the force proc modifier is placed on enemies, which makes Time Lock trigger on them.
Dispelling this debuff does not remove the Time Lock stun, but it prevents the Time Lock instant attack from occuring.
abilities.description: Rushes to a target location while backtracking any damage taken in the last 2 seconds.
params: Applies a Time Lock proc to all units at the landing destination.
Increases Time Walk cast range by 400. Grants a new ability: Reverse Time Walk.
Does not apply Time Lock on spell immune enemies.
Darkterror tears a hole in time, passing through Claszureme, and appearing back in an instant.
abilities.story: Darkterror tears a hole in time, passing through Claszureme, and appearing back in an instant.

notes: Affects units in the Fog of War and invisible units, but not invulnerable and hidden units.
Causes enemy cooldowns and charge-based abilities to recharge 60% slower while they have the debuff. Affects cooldowns of passive abilities, but does not affect the cooldown of items.
Affects cooldowns of passive abilities, but does not affect the cooldown of items.

The damage ticks in 1-second intervals, starting 1 second after the debuff is placed, resulting in 8/9/10/11 instance of damage. Time Dilation can deal up to 80/99/120/143 damage for every ability that is on cooldown for the entire duration of the debuff (before reductions).
Time Dilation can deal up to 80/99/120/143 damage for every ability that is on cooldown for the entire duration of the debuff (before reductions).

The slow has no stack limit. Each ability on cooldown adds a stack. Also counts the cooldown of hidden abilities, like Invoker's uninvoked spells or Morph, and abilities granted by Aghanim's Scepter and Aghanim's Shard. Rubick's stolen spells which are on cooldown and already lost do not count, as they are not hidden, but removed.
Also counts the cooldown of hidden abilities, like Invoker's uninvoked spells or Morph, and abilities granted by Aghanim's Scepter and Aghanim's Shard.
Rubick's stolen spells which are on cooldown and already lost do not count, as they are not hidden, but removed.
The slow debuff checks all cooldowns continuously, and adapts the slow value and stack count immediately.
Abilities affected by Time Dilation can still be reset (e.g. Refresher Orb).
Multiple instances of Time Dilation do not stack, but refresh the duration.
abilities.description: Faceless Void traps all nearby enemies in a time dilation field for 8/9/10/11 seconds, extending their cooldowns and slowing their movement and attack speed by 10% for each cooldown extended.
params: Damage per Second per Extended Cooldown: 10/11/12/13
Effects persist if debuff was placed before spell immunity and when not dispelled.
For those facing off against Darkterror, each moment seems to stretch into eternity.
abilities.story: For those facing off against Darkterror, each moment seems to stretch into eternity.

notes: Does not stack with other bashes. The bash from Skull Basher and Abyssal Blade is completely disabled for Faceless Void. In Ability Draft, fully stacks with the bash from Skull Basher and Abyssal Blade.
The bash from Skull Basher and Abyssal Blade is completely disabled for Faceless Void.
In Ability Draft, fully stacks with the bash from Skull Basher and Abyssal Blade.
The proccing attack first applies the debuff, then its own damage.
Time Lock works against allied units, but not against wards and buildings.

Upon proccing, the stun debuff gets applied. 0.33 seconds later, the second attack, and the damage applies. The bash damage is dealt in a separate instance and is spell damage. It is not added as attack damage. This means the damage works with spell lifesteal and spell damage amplification, but not with lifesteal, crit, or cleave. The second attack is an instant attack, which can proc any attack modifiers (including Time Lock itself) and on-hit effects normally, with cleave being an exception. They do not have True Strike.
The bash damage is dealt in a separate instance and is spell damage. It is not added as attack damage.
This means the damage works with spell lifesteal and spell damage amplification, but not with lifesteal, crit, or cleave.
The second attack is an instant attack, which can proc any attack modifiers (including Time Lock itself) and on-hit effects normally, with cleave being an exception. They do not have True Strike.
Despite the visual effect, the angle of the second attack is still based on Faceless Void's position, so cleave hits towards where he is facing, and not the image that appears.
Adds an average of 1.8/3.2/5/7.2 (TagTalent 8.4/12/16/20.4) damage to every attack.
Time Lock uses pseudo-random distribution.
abilities.description: Adds the chance for an attack to lock an enemy unit in time while attacking it a second time.
params: The strike of the Faceless Void lands with dimension shifting force.
abilities.story: The strike of the Faceless Void lands with dimension shifting force.

notes: Requires Aghanim's Shard to be unlocked.
Only available upon reaching the Time Walk destination point, and lasts until used, or up to 1.5 seconds.
When cast, it moves Faceless Void back to where he was as he cast Time Walk, using the same travel speed.
Does not reverse anything else. The health change are not reversed, and the Time Lock bash from the upgrade does not proc.
The health change are not reversed, and the Time Lock bash from the upgrade does not proc.
abilities.description: Replaces Time Walk with Reverse Time Walk for 1.5 seconds after landing. If used in this time period, you will reverse your time walk back to your previous cast location. Does not affect health or proc scepter hits.

notes: Chronosphere affects all units which are not owned by Faceless Void, including buildings, wards and allies.

Does not affect Couriers, hidden units and invulnerable heroes. All other invulnerable units are fully affected. Instantly destroys Homing Missile and The Swarm beetles. Instantly causes already latched Phantoms to return to their caster, and freezes traveling phantoms. Affected units are stunned. When other units walk inside the area, they also get affected for its remaining duration.
Instantly destroys Homing Missile and The Swarm beetles.
Instantly causes already latched Phantoms to return to their caster, and freezes traveling phantoms.
Affected units are stunned. When other units walk inside the area, they also get affected for its remaining duration.
While in the Chronosphere, Faceless Void and any units he controls are phased and hasted, meaning they cannot be slowed below the set value.

Faceless Void and illusions of him (be it his own, enemy or allied illusions) cannot be frozen by Chronospheres, regardless of source. This is innate to Faceless Void. However, the hasted and phased movement is only provided to the caster and their units. In Ability Draft, Faceless Void keeps his innate immunity to Chronospheres, even when not drafting it.
However, the hasted and phased movement is only provided to the caster and their units.
In Ability Draft, Faceless Void keeps his innate immunity to Chronospheres, even when not drafting it.
Provides flying vision and True Sight over the whole affected area for its duration.
Cancels most sources of Forced Movement upon applying the disabling debuff on a unit.

Units inside Chronosphere can be pulled out by various abilities. However, the following abilities or items cannot move units out of Chronosphere: Force Staff, Hurricane Pike, Psychic Headband, Telekinesis, Snowball and Geomagnetic Grip.
However, the following abilities or items cannot move units out of Chronosphere: Force Staff, Hurricane Pike, Psychic Headband, Telekinesis, Snowball and Geomagnetic Grip.
Despite its visual effects, the effective area is a cylinder not a sphere.
abilities.description: Creates a blister in spacetime, trapping all units caught in its sphere of influence and causes you to move very quickly inside it. Only Faceless Void and any units he controls are unaffected. Invisible enemies in the sphere will be revealed.
params: Faceless Void's immunity to Chronospheres is not disabled by Break.
When a rift opens to Claszureme, all poor souls caught within will likely never return.
abilities.story: When a rift opens to Claszureme, all poor souls caught within will likely never return.

notes: Grants Faceless Void a chance to avoid damage completely.

Backtrack belongs to the group of damage negating effects. It is not evasion. This means it only negates damage, it does not evade any side effects of spells or attacks, like disables. When an attack has e.g. Mana Break and Backtrack triggers on the attack, the damage is avoided, but the mana burn still takes effect. This also means that True Strike or Accuracy does not stop Backtrack from avoiding attack damage. Evasion has priority over Backtrack. When evasion procs, Backtrack cannot proc on that attack.
This means it only negates damage, it does not evade any side effects of spells or attacks, like disables.
When an attack has e.g. Mana Break and Backtrack triggers on the attack, the damage is avoided, but the mana burn still takes effect.
This also means that True Strike or Accuracy does not stop Backtrack from avoiding attack damage.
Evasion has priority over Backtrack. When evasion procs, Backtrack cannot proc on that attack.

Backtrack has the third highest priority in the group of damage negating effects. This means when combined with e.g. Aphotic Shield or Refraction, Backtrack negates damage while the other sources do not.
This means when combined with e.g. Aphotic Shield or Refraction, Backtrack negates damage while the other sources do not.

As with all damage manipulating effects, Backtrack can negate all 3 damage types (Physical, Magical and Pure). Increases Faceless Void's effective health by an average of 25% against those damage types.
Increases Faceless Void's effective health by an average of 25% against those damage types.
Fully ignores damage which is flagged as HP Removal.
Backtrack uses pseudo-random distribution.
abilities.description: There is no description for this ability.

description: Darkterror, the Faceless Void, is a melee agility hero played as an offlaner or carry. Given a little time, he becomes a terrifying hero capable of destroying entire enemy teams in seconds.
history: Darkterror the Faceless Void is a visitor from Claszureme, a realm outside of time. It remains a mystery why this being from another dimension believes the struggle for the Nemesis Stones is worth entering our physical plane, but apparently an upset in the balance of power in this world has repercussions in adjacent dimensions. Time means nothing to Darkterror, except as a way to thwart his foes and aid his allies. His long-view of the cosmos has given him a remote, disconnected quality, although in battle he is quite capable of making it personal.
